definition: to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
danger/dangerous/rugged

sentences.english: A bottle of spirits was launched in his direction but narrowly missed.
sentences.chinese: 向他投掷了一瓶烈酒，但有惊无险。

sentences.english: If you work in most other fields, you're likely nervous but not panic-stricken.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是在其他领域工作，那么你可能是有惊无险。

sentences.english: Luckily, it was a near miss, so we didn't encounter any problems.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，有惊无险，我们没有碰到任何问题。

definition: thrilling/a thriller
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
to just escape from calamity
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
safe and sound (idiom)
safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
luckily/fortunately
luckily/by a fluke
to take risks/involved in adventure
to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
smoothly/without a hitch
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
calligraphic flourish with many twists/fig. many twists and turns
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
fortunately (formal writing)
